methods.name: Topic
methods.description: A Topic object allows you to interact with a Google Cloud Pub/Sub topic. To get this object, you will use the methods on the pubsub object, pubsub#topic and pubsub#createTopic.

methods.name: publish
methods.description: Publish the provided message. A message can be of any type.

params.name: message.label
params.description: - List of labels for the message.

params.name: message.data
params.description: - The base64-encoded contents of the message.

methods.name: getSubscriptions
methods.description:
Get a list of the subscriptions registered to this topic. You may optionally provide a query object as the first argument to customize the response.

Your provided callback will either be invoked with an error object, if an API error occurred, or an array of pubsub/subscription objects.

params.name: query.maxResults
params.description: - Maximum number of results to return.

methods.name: subscribe
methods.description:
Create a subscription to this topic. You may optionally provide an object to customize the subscription.

Your provided callback will either be invoked with an error object, if an API error occurred, or a pubsub/subscription object.

params.name: options.ackDeadlineSeconds
params.description: - The maximum time after receiving a message that you must ack a message before it is redelivered.

params.name: options.autoAck
params.description: - Automatically acknowledge the message once it's pulled. (default: false)

params.name: options.interval
params.description: - Interval in milliseconds to check for new messages. (default: 10)

exceptions.description: If a name is not provided.

methods.name: subscription
methods.description: Create a Subscription object in reference to an existing subscription. This command by itself will not run any API requests. You will receive a pubsub/subscription object, which will allow you to interact with your subscription.

params.name: options.autoAck
params.description: - Automatically acknowledge the message once it's pulled.

params.name: options.interval
params.description: - Interval in milliseconds to check for new messages.

exceptions.description: If a name is not provided.
